lines.text: Believe me, Donna, ten million at the altar is worth twenty million in the bush!
Do you realize that I have guests downstairs, that Miss Lyons was singing? I thought the ceiling would come down!
Why didn't you stop her?
You say the most amusing things, Count.
Family trait, you know; a ready wit and complete lack of character. We drink, you know.
[Kay kicks him under the table]

[laughing]
Oh, how amusing! You drink. Oh, yes, of course, you drink.
They're funny things, these family traits. For instance, the Stuarts drink and the Craigs, they like to kick people. Tell me, what do the Lyonses do, madam?
The Lyons roar!
[laughs giddily]

[as the two girls give loathing looks at Donna Lyons while she sings]
Some savage tribes put honey all over people and let the ants devour them.
It's too hard to get enough ants.

[as they watch Lord Stuart dance with Donna Lyons, a glaring Kay has suddenly developed jealousy]
He's over-doing it!

[Happy to see their plan going well]
He's not bad for a drunkard.
I thought you were a gentleman!
I'm not a gentleman, I'm a father!
You're an old fool!
And you're an old
[pauses to think]
buzzard!
I'm not pig headed, I'm strong minded.

[after the waiter delivers her lunch in the restaurant, she feistily exclaims]
Muffins and milk! That's no food for fighters!
